node.title: CDC to significantly ease pandemic mask guidelines Friday
node.description: The Biden administration is shifting its focus to preventing serious illness and death from COVID-19, rather than all instances of infection.

node.title: Biden and Europe sit on this key Russia sanction
node.description: President Biden has ruled out removing Russia from the international banking system, but also said it's "always" an option.

node.title: Kyiv residents armed and "not ready to give up" their city to Russia
node.description: The Defense Ministry has called on anyone over the age of 18 to help defend the capital, and the people of Kyiv are turning up in droves.

node.title: Ukrainian soldiers defy Russians in final moment: "F*** you"
node.description: The soldiers who reportedly defied the Russian troops will be posthumously awarded as "Heroes of Ukraine," President Zelensky announced.

node.title: Americans are worried about smaller refunds — for good reason
node.description: The average refund so far in 2022 is about $2,300, down from last year's typical refund of $2,800.

node.title: Ketanji Brown Jackson is Biden's Supreme Court pick
node.description: If confirmed, she will be the first Black woman to serve on the highest court.

node.title: This NYPD detective had a secret: Her past
node.description: Detective Katrina Brownlee speaks out about joining the NYPD after she says it failed to protect her from her abusive fiancé – a correction officer.

node.title: Mom of boy found dead in freezer says suspect held her captive for months
node.description: The mother knew Brandon Toseland as an acquaintance of her husband, the father of her children, who died in 2021.

node.title: Trayvon Martin's mother on finding power through her pain: "He made me strong"
node.description: Sybrina Fulton and other women who have lost children and family members to senseless violence have helped empower each other.

node.title: Sean Penn is in Ukraine to film a documentary on the war
node.description: Penn attended a press briefing following Russia's "full-scale invasion" of the country. The office of the Ukrainian president said he is there to document the invasion.

node.title: Worldwide protests after Russia invades Ukraine
node.description: Hundreds of people in Russia were arrested for protesting the attack, as cities across the world rally in support of Ukraine.

node.title: 500 pound bear "Hank the Tank" may be off the hook in home break-ins
node.description: DNA evidence shows as manly as three other bears may be the culprit in more than 150 incident reports in the region straddling Northern California and Nevada.

node.title: Russia stripped of major soccer final after Ukraine invasion
node.description: UEFA announced the move following an extraordinary meeting of its executive committee to discuss the security situation in Europe.

node.title: Man sentenced to death for beheading woman who refused marriage
node.description: Zahir Jaffar's killing of Noor Mukadam shocked the nation and shed light on the pervasiveness of violence against women in Pakistan.

node.title: Sally Kellerman, "M*A*S*H" movie's "Hot Lips," has died at 84
node.description: The award-winning film and TV star was often confused with friend Loretta Swit, who played "Hot Lips" Houlihan in the long-running "M*A*S*H" TV series.

node.title: Ex-officer says man he killed in movie theater "looked like a monster"
node.description: Curtis Reeves testified he shot 43-year-old Chad Oulson because the younger, fitter man was cursing at him and about to attack him.

node.title: Va'aiga Tuigamala's legacy spans the world
node.description: Rugby legend Inga the Winger is being fondly remembered as a giant of the game.

node.title: Nine Hector's dolphins found dead in four months in South Island
node.description: Seven of the dead dolphins were calves, and the most recent discovery was a Hector's dolphin with its tail end missing at a beach near Mikonui, south of Hokitika, last week.

node.title: International court may probe Ukraine war crimes
node.description: International Criminal Court prosecutor Karim Khan on Friday expressed his concern over the Russian invasion of Ukraine and said his court may investigate possible war crimes in the country.

node.title: Port of Tauranga lifts half-year profit to $56.3m
node.description: The country's biggest port increased its profit in the face of supply chain disruptions, as it handled more containers, dairy and kiwifruit exports, which offset a slide in log traffic.

node.title: Omicron keeping people at bay in New Plymouth: 'It's a bit of a ghost town'
node.description: New Plymouth retailers say the CBD resembles a "ghost town" as the Omicron wave makes its presence felt around the country. Audio

node.title: Phoenix midfielder to return home to work on mental health
node.description: Wellington Phoenix midfielder Grace Wisnewski is returning home to New Zealand for mental health reasons.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 12,011 new community cases in NZ today, five deaths
node.description: There are 12,011 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, with five further deaths reported.

node.title: Black Caps eye top spot and a first series win over South Africa
node.description: The Black Caps will look to complete a maiden test series win over South Africa with victory in the second and final match in Christchurch.

node.title: Stars' coach will call retired Silver Ferns if Omicron overwhelms
node.description: Stars' coach Kiri Wills will approach retired Silver Ferns to get her side through the ANZ Premiership if Omicron wreaks havoc on the domestic league.

node.title: NZ Consul in Ukraine: 'These deep booms ... oh God, one just went off'
node.description: People are sheltering in metro stations as blasts continue in Kyiv, and queues to cross into Poland stretch for 30km to 40km, the Honorary Consul for New Zealand in Ukraine says.

node.title: Tourism Holding reports $4.4 million half-year loss
node.description: Campervan and tourism operator Tourism Holdings has reported another first half loss, as the pandemic continues to curtail the sector's operations.

node.title: Ukraine Ambassador urges military support, more sanctions
node.description: Ukraine's Ambassador is calling for the world to show its condemnation of Russia by imposing significant and co-ordinated sanctions, and offering military support.

node.title: Covid-19: Surge in Dargaville cases worries low-vaccinated area
node.description: Health officials are concerned about an outbreak of Covid-19 in the Northland town of Dargaville.

node.title: Biden administration considering protecting Ukrainians in the U.S. from deportation
node.description: The deportation protections would only apply to Ukrainians already in the U.S., not new arrivals.
